title: Taking a cue from traditional Chinese medicine for transdermal insulin delivery
author: Fraiser Kansteiner
description: For people taking drugs like insulin, injections are part of their daily routines—but that route can be intimidating and painful. | Singaporean scientists have created a pressure device, much like a vise clamp for the skin, that changes the skin barrier through the formation of "micropores." And, according to mouse research, the micropores improve transdermal delivery of drugs, such as insulin, that are typically injected with syringes or through microneedle patches.
